stories.title: Major incident declared in London as fires burn
Netflix crackdown on password sharing now includes $2.99 “extra home” fee

stories.text:
We recently plugged in GPT-3 to our software which can record / transcribe / search and share meetings - and have been quite baffled by the quality of the meeting minutes outputted.

GPT-3 understands what a discussion revolves around - even if it's only mentionned once - and summarizes it really efficiently. It lays out the different topics and always puts forward the next steps.

Linked is a quick example on one of my conversations with a company in the Philippines.

An amusing bug was that if for whatever reason no to little transcription was outputted, GPT-3 would insult the participants (is it trained on Reddit??).

The danger would be if GPT-3 misinterprets something and this then gets into the formal decision process of a company. However I haven't seen it yet and for the moment have only been baffled by the results.

Check it out it's free to try out: https://spoke.app/welcome :)
